question: 剣
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are the same. That means they share meanings as well. This word covers all types of <vocabulary>sword</vocabulary>s and <vocabulary>sabre</vocabulary>s, though it was originally used mostly for <vocabulary>double-edged sword</vocabulary>s.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This has the same reading as the kanji you learned, meaning you know the reading!

This word can also be read <ja>つるぎ</ja>, but in that case its meaning is limited to Western-style swords only. Because of the meaning difference, we only accept the <ja>けん</ja> reading (but you'll get another try if you enter <ja>つるぎ</ja>).
